name: chiller
content:
chiller noun [C]
(COLD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a container or room for keeping food or drinks cold: In hot weather it is better to store seafood in the chiller. The vegetables were all in a chiller with no prices displayed. a chiller cabinet/shelf
a machine or device for making or keeping a place, a substance, etc. cold: Efficient new chillers in the office building are expected to cut energy use by 10 to 12 percent. The pipes form part of a high-efficiency chiller system. I like these wine-bottle chillers. See also
blast chiller
chill cabinet
More examplesFewer examplesThe beef is hung in a chiller for three to four weeks.That fresh fish on the chiller shelf in the supermarket is at least two weeks old.A large box called a chiller freezes water during the night.There was a malfunction with a chiller that is set to kick in when the water gets too hot.

chiller noun [C]
(FRIGHTENING)
theatre & film, literature
  specialized, informal a frightening film, book, story, etc.: He directed Dawn of the Dead, the classic 1978 chiller. Wilkie Collins' 1860 novel "The Woman In White" is a Victorian chiller with a twisted yet charismatic villain. Synonym
spine-chiller
More examplesFewer examplesWe've picked ten of the creepiest chillers in cinema history.The novel is a short, realistic chiller about a postapocalyptic world. "The Piano Teacher" is an intriguing little chiller that opened last night at the Mill Theatre.
